violation_categories: 1. Forbidden time references (2024 in work context, 'last month', 'recently')
2. Current work references ('at work', 'our systems', 'my employer')
3. Active vulnerability disclosure (breach, incident without time buffer)
4. Specific system references (government systems, agency names)

phase_1_simple_findreplace.description: Posts requiring simple find/replace or minor wording changes (≤5 violations, straightforward fixes)

phase_2_moderate_context.description: Posts requiring 1-3 paragraph rewrites and contextual changes (6-10 violations, moderate complexity)

phase_3_complex_sections.description: Posts requiring multiple section rewrites and structural changes (>10 violations, high complexity)

violations.line_context: Line 23: 'Years ago, I discovered a glaring SQL injection vulnerability in an internal application during a routine code review.'
violations.violation_text: 'Years ago' is acceptable, but 'internal application' + 'routine code review' implies recent work context
violations.replacement_pattern: 'Years ago' → good. Change 'internal application during a routine code review' → 'application I was reviewing'

violations.line_context: Line 25: 'That incident happened early in my career, and I still remember the quiet panic as we scrambled to patch it before anyone noticed.'
violations.violation_text: 'we scrambled' implies work team context without time buffer

violations.line_context: Line 74: 'Years ago during a penetration test, the tester showed me how they could have used that over-privileged service to dump our entire user table.'
violations.violation_text: 'our entire user table' implies organizational ownership
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our entire user table' → 'the application's user table'

violations.line_context: Line 84: 'Early in my career, I thought validation was just checking for empty fields. Then I watched a colleague demonstrate...'
Line 24: '**Three days into a production crisis**, our payment processor had stopped accepting SSL certificates.'
violations.violation_text: 'our payment processor' implies organizational ownership, 'production crisis' implies work context
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our payment processor' → 'a payment processor I was working with years ago'; add time buffer

violations.line_context: Line 38: 'This perception changed dramatically when I spent three sleepless nights debugging SSL certificate issues that were breaking our entire payment system.'
violations.violation_text: 'our entire payment system' implies organizational ownership
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our entire payment system' → 'the payment system I was working on years ago'

violations.line_context: Line 209: '**In 2017, I implemented a document signing system for legal contracts:**'
violations.violation_text: Specific year (2017) creates timeline for work project

violations.line_context: Line 24-32: Multiple 2024 timestamps for homelab work
violations.violation_text: January 2024, February 2024, March 2024 - all recent timestamps
violations.replacement_pattern: Replace specific 2024 timestamps with 'recently in my homelab' or remove month specificity

violations.line_context: Line 70: 'our security team had been tracking unusual database queries'
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our security team' → 'security monitoring systems I set up in my homelab'

violations.line_context: Line 80: 'When I ran OSV-Scanner v1.5.0 across our entire stack in March 2024...'
violations.violation_text: 'our entire stack' implies organizational ownership, March 2024 recent
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our entire stack' → 'my homelab stack'; '2024' → remove or generalize

violations.line_context: Line 106-112: Multiple uses of 'our' for organizational systems
violations.violation_text: 'our user table', 'our Kubernetes cluster', 'our infrastructure' - organizational ownership
violations.replacement_pattern: Replace all 'our' with 'my homelab' or 'the system I was managing'

violations.line_context: Line 125: 'Years ago during a penetration test, the tester showed me...'
violations.violation_text: Acceptable use of 'years ago', good pattern
violations.replacement_pattern: N/A - this is correct NDA-safe pattern

violations.line_context: Line 27: 'CVE-2023-5678 with a CVSS score of 9.8'
violations.violation_text: Recent CVE (2023) without sufficient time buffer
violations.replacement_pattern: Acceptable - public CVE, but add 'publicly disclosed' qualifier

violations.line_context: Line 27: 'In January 2024, I downloaded 50 known deepfake videos'
Line 72: 'In February 2024, I tried generating my own deepfake'
Line 80: 'A colleague in the public sector once showed me how deepfakes were being used...'
violations.replacement_pattern: 'colleague in the public sector' → 'someone I know who works in government' (maintains distance)

violations.line_context: Line 82: 'Years ago, a CEO was tricked into authorizing a $243,000 wire transfer'
violations.violation_text: Good use of 'years ago' but specific dollar amount may imply insider knowledge
violations.replacement_pattern: Acceptable - public news story, but could add 'according to published reports'

Line 107: 'I conducted an informal experiment in early February 2024'
Line 21: 'In January 2024, I spent three days trying to load Llama 3 70B'
Line 84: 'In early 2024, I ran two experiments'

violations.line_context: Line 233: 'When I first tested Llama 2 7B in July 2023...'
Line 22: 'I recall standing in our data center in late 2019'
violations.violation_text: 'our data center' implies organizational ownership, specific year

violations.line_context: Line 43-71: Multiple uses of 'our' and 'we'
violations.violation_text: 'our migration', 'our fastest-growing service', 'our competitors', 'we were paying' - organizational ownership
violations.replacement_pattern: Replace 'our/we' with 'the organization I worked with years ago' or shift to hypothetical

violations.line_context: Line 70: 'A power outage in August 2019 that lasted six hours cost us approximately $78,000'
violations.violation_text: Specific organizational incident with financial details, recent year
violations.replacement_pattern: 'August 2019' → 'years ago'; 'cost us' → 'cost the organization'; OR make hypothetical: 'In one case I'm familiar with...'

violations.line_context: Line 76-84: Entire migration planning section uses 'our'
violations.violation_text: 'Our initial approach', 'Our systems', 'our services' - organizational ownership throughout
violations.replacement_pattern: Rewrite section to use 'the organization's' or shift to general lessons learned

violations.line_context: Line 97: 'Setting up proper IAM was both the most complex and most valuable part of our migration'
violations.replacement_pattern: 'our migration' → 'the migration I worked on years ago'

violations.line_context: Line 116: 'A minor DDoS attack in March 2020 triggered automatic scaling that cost us $4,200'
violations.violation_text: Specific organizational incident with financial details, recent year
violations.replacement_pattern: 'March 2020' → 'years ago'; 'cost us' → 'cost the organization'; add time buffer

violations.line_context: Line 117: 'I was cleaning up firewall rules and removed SSH access before properly configuring our VPN'

detailed_analysis.notes: This post is mostly NDA-compliant. All technical work is attributed to homelab experiments. No violations found - categorizing as Phase 2 due to thorough review needed, but actual remediation minimal.

critical_first.reason: 15 violations, extensive organizational ownership ('our data center', 'our migration'), specific incidents with financial details
12 violations, organizational ownership patterns ('our security team', 'our infrastructure')
14 violations, mostly 2024 timestamps but needs systematic remediation
9 violations, organizational ownership ('our customer service AI', 'our systems')
8 violations, mix of timestamps and organizational references
7 violations, mix of timestamps and organizational references
6 violations, mostly timestamps and minor references
5 violations, mostly timestamps, good homelab attribution
4 violations, all timestamp-related, good homelab attribution
0 violations detected - excellent homelab attribution throughout

our/we_patterns: 'our systems' → 'systems I worked with years ago'
'our data center' → 'a data center I worked in years ago'
'our team' → 'a team I worked with years ago'
'our migration' → 'the migration I worked on years ago'
implicit_ownership: 'customer service AI' → 'a customer service AI I worked on years ago'

incidents: Add time buffer: 'years ago' to any security incident
Make hypothetical: 'In one case I'm familiar with...'
Remove financial specifics or generalize: '$78,000' → 'significant cost'

recommendations.remediation_strategy: Address in priority order (Critical → High → Medium → Low). Phase 3 posts require most attention. Consider batching Phase 1 posts for efficiency.
recommendations.quality_assurance: After remediation, run grep searches for forbidden patterns: 'our systems', 'at work', '2024' in work context, 'colleague', etc.
validation_checklist: No 'our/we' organizational ownership without time buffer
All security incidents have 2-3 year minimum buffer
No specific 2023-2024 timestamps for work context
All production incidents attributed to 'years ago' or homelab
No current employer, team, or colleague references
Homelab attribution clear for all personal experiments
